content: Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein is resigning, according to Axios, which cited a source familiar with the matter.

tag: html body div div div div div div div ul li span
content: NBC News, however, says Rosenstein will refuse to resign if asked to do so.

content: Deputy AG Rod Rosenstein to meet with President Trump Thursday over Times article

content: will meet with Deputy Attorney General

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: on Thursday amid swirling reports that the No. 2 Justice Department official's departure is imminent.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: "At the request of Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, he and President Trump had an extended conversation to discuss the recent news stories," White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders said in a statement.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: "Because the President is at the United Nations General Assembly and has a full schedule with leaders from around the world, they will meet on Thursday when the President returns to Washington, D.C."

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Axios published a bombshell report Monday that Rosenstein is resigning, citing sources with knowledge.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: But the report was contradicted by other news outlets, including from NBC News' Pete Williams, who reported that Rosenstein would not resign of his own accord after his off-the-cuff comments about possibly recording and removing Trump were revealed last week.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: He will only depart if the White House fired him and will refuse to resign if asked to do so, Williams reported. News of Rosenstein's potential departure was a "huge shock" to the Justice Department, Williams added.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Although Trump has sharply criticized Rosenstein over the Russia probe, his departure could create a big problem for the White House: filling the position six weeks before the crucial midterm elections.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
content: Justice Department official told The New York Times

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: that if Rosenstein is out, then Solicitor General Noel Francisco would oversee the Russia investigation.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Shortly after the resignation reports, Rosenstein was at the White House for a previously-scheduled principals meeting, a Justice Department official told NBC. Trump arrived in New York City on Sunday for the United Nations General Assembly. He was scheduled to have dinner with Japanese Prime Minister

content: Rosenstein exit could put Trump in political firestorm

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div div a div time span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Bloomberg reported that Rosenstein told White House chief of staff John Kelly that he would resign, citing a person familiar with the matter.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Rosenstein's possible departure will immediately raise questions about the fate of the ongoing investigation by Mueller, who is probing Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election, and possible obstruction of justice by Trump.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: The special counsel's office declined to comment on the report.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
content: called into question after the Times reported

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: last week that the No. 2 DOJ official had discussed invoking the 25th Amendment to remove Trump and had talked about surreptitiously recording the president.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Other reports, however, suggested that Rosenstein

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
content: was being sarcastic when he made those comments

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: In an interview with radio host Geraldo Rivera over the weekend, Trump hinted that he was considering firing Rosenstein.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: "Certainly it's being looked at in terms of what took place, if anything took place. I'll make a determination sometime later but I don't have the facts," Trump said when asked if he would cut Rosenstein loose over the reports.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Rosenstein oversees the special counsel investigation, and has appointed Mueller to run the Russia probe last year, after Attorney General

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: The White House did not immediately respond to CNBC's request for comment on Axios' report. The Justice Department did not immediately respond to CNBC's inquiry.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Trump has repeatedly blasted Mueller's inquiry, which also is focused on possible collusion with Russia by members of the Trump campaign.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: He has called the investigation a "witch hunt," and has repeatedly vented frustration about Sessions' recusal, which directly led to Mueller's appointment by Rosenstein.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div div div span span

content: Trump: Hopefully Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh will be confirmed quickly

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div div a div time span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Joe Moreno, a former federal prosecutor who is now a partner at the law firm Cadwalader, said that the fallout could be "significant."

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: "Both sides of this thing, whether you are the president's supporter or not, had some comfort having someone of his stature in that position, both in general, in the day-to-day operations of the Justice Department and with respect to the Russia probe," Moreno said.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Rosenstein's expected departure comes on the heels of a guilty plea by Trump's former campaign manager

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: to conspiracy charges related to his consulting work in Ukraine, which predates his role on the campaign.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: As part of the investigation, Mueller's team has been locked in an ongoing back-and-forth with Trump's legal team over an in-person interview with the president. Trump's lawyers, including former New York Mayor

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: , have signaled that Trump is unwilling to sit for an interview, calling it a "perjury trap" and setting up a potential challenge for Mueller to subpoena the president.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Mueller's broad mandate to investigate matters that "may arise directly" from the Russia probe has led to numerous indictments and guilty pleas from Trump's associates.

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: Among those are Trump's former national security advisor

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: , who pleaded guilty in December 2017 to lying to the FBI, and Trump's longtime personal lawyer

tag: html body div div section div article div div div div p a span
html body div div section div article div div div div p span
content: , who pleaded guilty to campaign finance violations after his case was referred to Manhattan federal agents by Mueller's team.
